009package imagingbook.common.filter.mask;
010
011import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
013
014import java.util.Objects;
015
016/**
017 * This class defines a binary mask, as used in filters, for example.
018 * 
019 * @author WB
020 * @version 2022/09/10
021 */
022public class BinaryMask {
023        // TODO: check against structuring elements for binary morphology
024        
025        private final int width;                        // mask center position (x)
026        private final int height;                       // mask center position (y)
027        private final int centerX;                      // mask center position (x)
028        private final int centerY;                      // mask center position (y)
029        private final int count;                        // number of nonzero mask elements
030        private final byte[][] mask;            // mask[x][y] specifies the support region
031        
032        public BinaryMask(byte[][] mask, int centerX, int centerY) {
033                Objects.requireNonNull(mask);
034                this.mask = mask;
035                this.width = mask.length;
036                this.height = mask[0].length;
037                this.centerX = centerX;
038                this.centerY = centerY;
039                this.count = countElements(mask);
040        }
041        
042        public BinaryMask(byte[][] mask) {
043                this(mask, mask.length/2, mask[0].length/2);
044        }
045
046        private int countElements(byte[][] maskArray) {
047                int cnt = 0;
048                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
049                        if (maskArray[x].length != height) {
050                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("mask array is not rectangular");
051                        }
052                        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
053                                if (maskArray[x][y] != 0)
054                                        cnt = cnt + 1;
055                        }
056                }
057                return cnt;
058        }
059        
060        public int getWidth() {
061                return this.width;
062        }
063        
064        public int getHeight() {
065                return this.height;
066        }
067        
068        /**
069         * Returns the x-coordinate of the mask's reference point.
070         * @return the x-coordinate of the mask's reference point
071         */
072        public int getCenterX() {
073                return centerX;
074        }
075        
076        /**
077         * Returns the y-coordinate of the mask's reference point.
078         * @return the y-coordinate of the mask's reference point
079         */
080        public int getCenterY() {
081                return centerY;
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Returns the number of inside-mask (1) elements.
086         * @return the number of inside-mask elements
087         */
088        public int getElementCount() {
089                return count;
090        }
091
092        /**
093         * Returns a {@code byte[x][y]} with outside mask element values zero, inside mask elements non-zero. The first
094         * array index corresponds to the horizontal coordinate.
095         *
096         * @return the mask as a {@code byte[][]}
097         */
098        public byte[][] getByteArray() {
099                return mask;
100        }
101
102        /**
103         * Returns a {@code byte[x][y]} with outside mask element values zero, inside mask elements non-zero. The first
104         * array index corresponds to the horizontal coordinate.
105         *
106         * @return the mask as a {@code byte[][]}
107         */
108        public ByteProcessor getByteProcessor() {
109                ByteProcessor bp = IjUtils.toByteProcessor(mask);
110                bp.threshold(0);
111                return bp;
112        }
113
114}
